result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua B Rinehart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 1:26pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kyle Reimann.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW; Written DEJ agreement filed.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond is addressed first; Atty Reimann requests no contact be lifted as deferred entry is being requested - State has conferred with victim, and victim wants no contact lifted.
COURT lifts no contact provision, and removes no contact w/victim from bond -- Defendant to sign new bond.

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Strangulation/Suffocation/DA)>>D&RI
Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis.
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 2 to State DC with recommendation of CC to be paid.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. No contact with victim(s): S.R. (NON WAIVABLE). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. MCSD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
